poem:
**A Shift in Time**

As clocks retreat an hour,  
summer whispers its farewell,  
leaves caught in a lingering dance.  
An hour gifted to sleepyheads,  
yet night workers plod through elastic hours,  
their nightly routine stretched thin.  
Meanwhile, dogs and children greet dawn  
as if nothing has changed—  
oblivious to our delicate joke with time.
